annotatable.title: Twitter Rant (September 2016)

children: On September 15, 2016, Kid Cudi took to Twitter to air some of his grievances about the music industry and how he has felt rejected and ignored by those he formerly called his friends and mentors. (The Tweets are presented here on Genius in prose form).
Most notably, he called out Drake and Kanye on their use of ghostwriters and their roles at the top of the contemporary hip-hop scene.
https://twitter.com/KidCudi/status/776101032191332352?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

raw.lyrics:
I need yall to know I got so many haters within the industry and these clowns know Im bout to crush their entire existance. Everyone thinks they're soooo great. Talkin top 5 and be having 30 people write songs for them. Let me tell you something. The days of the fuckery are over. The fake ones wont be lasting too much longer.
Im the one they worry about cause they know I dont give a fuck about the corny shit they do. All my youngins out here reppin, Asap Rocky and the whole ASAP family, Travis Scott, SuperDuper Kyle, Audio Push, Hit Boy, etc, I see yall. And all u jealous chicken hearted shits I see you too.
I am the culture.
I keep silent because I dont ever wanna come off like some angry hater, but today, not only do I feel fantastic, Im feelin like taking over. I already have.
My tweets apply to who they apply. Ye, Drake, whoever. These niggas dont give a fuck about me. And they aint fuckin with me. Niggas keep you close when they see how powerful you are by yourself. When they see your greatness. Out of fear
Ive been loyal to those who haven't been to me and that ends now. Now im your threat.
Anybody got a issue with my words im glad. If you feel me, dont be scared to use your voice. I was for so long out of blind loyalty.
From here Ill let the music speak. As you were, peace and love to my supporters and true ones.  🤘🏾🌹❤️
Cudder Out

songs.title: Unfuckwittable
songs.lyrics:
You could fly
Nobody can touch you… Nobody
You could fly
Nobody can touch you

Ain't no question, ain't no conspiracy
Keep on searching for love, who else is incomplete?
There's so many good vibes just floatin' around in the world
And when the ground and sky combine, oh yeah
I'm feeling more than fine
I'm so Rock and Rollie

Don't you feel it? Feel it? Feel It?
Don't you know that I'm unfuckwittable?
Don't you feel it?
You know that I'm unfuckwittable?

One day I knew no one could help me in Hell
Not many people are true, fake as the lies they tell
The world is filled with good vibes, and that is what I seek
And now I'm feeling more than cool, oh yeah
I'm feeling more than cool
Them Jokers can't hold me

Don't you feel it? Feel it? Feel It?
You know that I'm unfuckwittable?
Don't you feel it?
You know that I'm unfuckwittable?

Don't you feel it? Feel it? Feel It?
Don't you know that I'm unfuckwittable?
Don't you feel it?
Don't you know that I'm unfuckwittable?

children: Second track (and first song) on Kid Cudi’s third studio album,
Indicud
. Elements of Kid Cudi’s alternative project
WZRD
can be seen throughout this song.
Unfuckwittable brings many positive vibes and feelings of empowerment Cudi promised with this album. The main message is similar to that of
“Immortal”
, he’s invincible and no one can bring him down. “dont you feel it”?

songs.title: Welcome To The World
songs.lyrics:
(Welcome to the world, welcome to the world)
You got your pop star, I'll be your rock star
When it's a suicide, you call it superstar
Check out the forecast, predictions won't stop
You get your fifteen, and then they take the spot
Lets go, lets go and then you're ready to go
Lets go lets go 'cause it's the end of the show
Lets go lets go so just get ready to go
Lets go lets go, lets go lets go

All the time that you were gone
I thought about how things went wrong
Now you're coming down to earth
Okay, hello, welcome to the world
She saw the bright lights, she caught the fever
She got contagious, she never leave it
So no more time spent and no more free shit
In fact this free ride has reached its destination
Lets go, lets go and then you're ready to go
Lets go lets go 'cause it's the end of the show
Lets go lets go and when its over, you'll know
Lets go lets go, lets go lets go

Life's a tour, I'm so sure
The ex so pure before you exit girl
No more games, I confess
Far from lame I'm just so fresh
Who but me? It's the big boss
New kid on the block, Mr. Rudolf (Kevin)
Two stars, hold your applause
I hold it down he holds all guitars
Half my life I sacrificed, but I only came to party tonight
New chicks, get my drinks up
Every weekend we can link up
New rings, with the pink cuts
You'll need a passport, get your Minks up
Took my turn she love it, each touch
And when she closes her eyes this what she thinks of, Boss

Welcome to the world, welcome to the world, welcome to the world, welcome to the world

children: The eleventh track off of Kid Cudi’s first mixtape
A Kid Named Cudi

samples Outkast’s “Pink & Blue.”  Cudi raps about his infatuation with women, speaking in particular to his sexual desires.  This is a prevalent theme as well in the song’s sample, as well as throughout Outkast’s entire
Speakerboxxx/The Love Below

children: Produced By Plain Pat and Emile

This song symbolizes the general mood of the first half of the MOTMII. Cudi is caught up in the high and the mood, feelings, and themes that come with the high. It’s a general anthem reiterating one of cudi’s many lessons of not giving a fuck.
Recently confirmed by Cudi from
Twitter
, the final “mumble” of the song is indeed
“sometimes you just dont care about shit. Sometimes you just dont give a fuck” slowed down, and a reversed.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=C4OkTt8KFME

songs.lyrics:

Hmmm, of course we all have times when we're weak

I'ma sew these wounds, I'ma sew these wounds myself
Hmmm, hmmm

So why aren't I whole?
You know you better dig deeper
Don't lie to you
You better dig deep, deep

I'ma sew these wounds, I-I'ma sew these wounds myself
I'ma sew these wounds, I'ma sew these wounds myself
Hmmm, hmmm

I'ma sew these wounds
(I, I, I, I....)

children: “Wounds” is a track about overcoming mental blockages that stop us from being our ideal selves. Cudi sings about ‘sewing his wounds himself,’ an image of perseverance and self-overcoming.
Passion, Pain & Demon Slayin'
subscribes to a four-act structure. “Wounds” is the third track in Act III: Niveaux de l'Amour. This title translates to Act III: Levels of Love.

children: Cudder switches things up here, collaborating with amazing folk singer
Father John Misty
. As with the rest of the songs on
Indicud
, this was personally produced by Scott himself, here using a sample from Father John Misty’s track
“Hollywood Forever Cemetery Sings”
The song focuses on a mysterious young girl, which led to great speculation among listeners, but was later revealed, suprisingly, to be Emma Watson.
https://twitter.com/KidCudi/status/666555892578385921
Misty explained how this came about in
an interview:

We didn’t converse much. He heard my music in a vintage boutique store in Hollywood that a friend of mine [owns]. She was playing the album in the store and he asked her what it was. She told him and he ended up sampling it and then I got an email from his management. But I did go into the studio with him for a day, put down some backing vocals, and we just kind of tripped out.
